channel.title: Kaoto | Free and Open Source Integration Editor
channel.description: Recent content on Kaoto | Free and Open Source Integration Editor

item.title: Step Extension API
item.description: We previously showed you how you can extend Kaoto with custom views called Step Extensions.

item.title: No code deployment via Camel K
item.description: On the following video we can see how to do a no code integration and deploy it in a cluster via Camel K.

item.title: Version 0.2.0 released with improved editor!
item.description: We have a new pre-release version v0.2.0 of Kaoto with a fancy refactored editor!

item.title: Hello World
item.description: On this video we can see we can drag and drop step into the integration and how to use the plus button to add intermediate and final steps.

item.title: Kaoto Over Docker
item.description: There is a Docker Hub KaotoIO organization in which you can find all the docker images for both frontend and backend.

item.title: Add a Custom View
item.description: Kaoto’s frontend is extendable, allowing you to create custom views that you can configure to show for specific steps.

item.title: Kaoto 0.1 is released!
item.description: The first version of Kaoto has been released. In this version, you can already edit a Kamelet Binding both visually and using the YAML editor.

item.title: Architecture
item.description: The architecture of Kaoto is designed to follow the Micro Frontends architectural style.

item.title: Add a New DSL
item.description: Kaoto’s frontend is agnostic of the DSL (Domain Specific Language) used, so to add support for a new DSL we just have to implement the specific endpoints on the API .
